trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Integrating NetSuite with Azure Active Directory | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Integrating NetSuite with Azure Active Directory | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use NetSuite with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use NetSuite with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: How to integrate NetSuite with Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: How to integrate NetSuite with Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will show you how to connect your NetSuite environment to your Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will show you how to connect your NetSuite environment to your Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to configure single sign-on to NetSuite, how to enable automated user provisioning, and how to assign users to have access to NetSuite.
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to configure single sign-on to NetSuite, how to enable automated user provisioning, and how to assign users to have access to NetSuite.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To access Azure Active Directory through the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), you must first have a valid Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: To access Azure Active Directory through the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), you must first have a valid Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: You must have admin access to a [NetSuite](http://www.netsuite.com/portal/home.shtml) subscription.
trans-unit.target: You must have admin access to a [NetSuite](http://www.netsuite.com/portal/home.shtml) subscription.

trans-unit.source: You may use a free trial account for either service.
trans-unit.target: You may use a free trial account for either service.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Add NetSuite to your Directory
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Add NetSuite to your Directory

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Select Active Directory from the left navigation pane.
trans-unit.target: Select Active Directory from the left navigation pane.

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory that you would like to add NetSuite to.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory that you would like to add NetSuite to.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Click on Applications.
trans-unit.target: Click on Applications.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click Add to add a new application.
trans-unit.target: Click Add to add a new application.

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: Click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **NetSuite**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **NetSuite**.

trans-unit.source: Then select **NetSuite** from the results, and click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: Then select **NetSuite** from the results, and click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Add NetSuite.
trans-unit.target: Add NetSuite.

trans-unit.source: You should now see the Quick Start page for NetSuite:
trans-unit.target: You should now see the Quick Start page for NetSuite:

trans-unit.source: NetSuite's Quick Start page in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: NetSuite's Quick Start page in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Enable Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Enable Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, on the Quick Start page for NetSuite, click the **Configure single sign-on** button.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, on the Quick Start page for NetSuite, click the **Configure single sign-on** button.

trans-unit.source: The configure single sign-on button
trans-unit.target: The configure single sign-on button

trans-unit.source: A dialog will open and you'll see a screen that asks "How would you like users to sign on to NetSuite?"
trans-unit.target: A dialog will open and you'll see a screen that asks "How would you like users to sign on to NetSuite?"

trans-unit.source: Select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select Azure AD Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Select Azure AD Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To learn more about about the different single sign-on options, [click here](../active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis/#how-does-single-sign-on-with-azure-active-directory-work)
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To learn more about about the different single sign-on options, [click here](../active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis/#how-does-single-sign-on-with-azure-active-directory-work)

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App Settings** page, for the **Sign On URL** field, type in your NetSuite tenant URL using one of the following formats:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App Settings** page, for the **Sign On URL** field, type in your NetSuite tenant URL using one of the following formats:

trans-unit.source: Type in your tenant URL
trans-unit.target: Type in your tenant URL

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at NetSuite** page, click on **Download metadata**, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at NetSuite** page, click on **Download metadata**, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Download the metadata.
trans-unit.target: Download the metadata.

trans-unit.source: Open a new tab in your browser, and sign into your Netsuite company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open a new tab in your browser, and sign into your Netsuite company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar at the top of the page, click **Setup**, then click **Setup Manager**.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar at the top of the page, click **Setup**, then click **Setup Manager**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup Manager
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup Manager

trans-unit.source: From the **Setup Tasks** list, select **Integration**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Setup Tasks** list, select **Integration**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Integration
trans-unit.target: Go to Integration

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Authentication** section, click **SAML Single Sign-on**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Authentication** section, click **SAML Single Sign-on**.

trans-unit.source: Go to SAML Single Sign-on
trans-unit.target: Go to SAML Single Sign-on

trans-unit.source: On the **SAML Setup** page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **SAML Setup** page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In Azure Active Directory, copy the **Remote Login URL** value and paste it into the **Identity Provider Login Page** field in NetSuite.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Active Directory, copy the **Remote Login URL** value and paste it into the **Identity Provider Login Page** field in NetSuite.

trans-unit.source: The SAML Setup page.
trans-unit.target: The SAML Setup page.

trans-unit.source: In NetSuite, select **Primary Authentication Method**.
trans-unit.target: In NetSuite, select **Primary Authentication Method**.

trans-unit.source: For the field labeled **SAMLV2 Identity Provider Metadata**, select **Upload IDP Metadata File**.
trans-unit.target: For the field labeled **SAMLV2 Identity Provider Metadata**, select **Upload IDP Metadata File**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Browse** to upload the metadata file that you downloaded in step #4.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Browse** to upload the metadata file that you downloaded in step #4.

trans-unit.source: Upload the metadata
trans-unit.target: Upload the metadata

trans-unit.source: Click **Submit**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Submit**.

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation checkbox to enable the certificate that you uploaded to NetSuite.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation checkbox to enable the certificate that you uploaded to NetSuite.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Check the confirmation checkbox
trans-unit.target: Check the confirmation checkbox

trans-unit.source: On the final page of the dialog, type in an email address if you would like to receive email notifications for errors and warnings related to the maintenance of this single sign-on configuration.
trans-unit.target: On the final page of the dialog, type in an email address if you would like to receive email notifications for errors and warnings related to the maintenance of this single sign-on configuration.

trans-unit.source: Type in your email address.
trans-unit.target: Type in your email address.

trans-unit.source: Click **Complete** to close the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **Complete** to close the dialog.

trans-unit.source: Next, click on **Attributes** at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Next, click on **Attributes** at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click on Attributes.
trans-unit.target: Click on Attributes.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Add User Attribute**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Add User Attribute**.

trans-unit.source: Click on Add User Attribute.
trans-unit.target: Click on Add User Attribute.

trans-unit.source: For the **Attribute Name** field, type in `account`.
trans-unit.target: For the **Attribute Name** field, type in `account`.

trans-unit.source: For the **Attribute Value** field, type in your NetSuite account ID.
trans-unit.target: For the **Attribute Value** field, type in your NetSuite account ID.

trans-unit.source: Instructions on how to find your account ID are included below:
trans-unit.target: Instructions on how to find your account ID are included below:

trans-unit.source: Add your NetSuite Account ID.
trans-unit.target: Add your NetSuite Account ID.

trans-unit.source: In NetSuite, click on **Setup** from the top navigation menu.
trans-unit.target: In NetSuite, click on **Setup** from the top navigation menu.

trans-unit.source: Then click under the **Setup Tasks** section of the left navigation menu, select the **Integration** section, and click on **Web Services Preferences**.
trans-unit.target: Then click under the **Setup Tasks** section of the left navigation menu, select the **Integration** section, and click on **Web Services Preferences**.

trans-unit.source: Copy your NetSuite Account ID and paste it into the **Attribute Value** field in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Copy your NetSuite Account ID and paste it into the **Attribute Value** field in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Get your account ID
trans-unit.target: Get your account ID

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, click **Complete** to finish adding the SAML attribute.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, click **Complete** to finish adding the SAML attribute.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Apply Changes** on the bottom menu.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Apply Changes** on the bottom menu.

trans-unit.source: Save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Save your changes.

trans-unit.source: Before users can perform single sign-on into NetSuite, they must first be assigned the appropriate permissions in NetSuite.
trans-unit.target: Before users can perform single sign-on into NetSuite, they must first be assigned the appropriate permissions in NetSuite.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions below to assign these permissions.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions below to assign these permissions.

trans-unit.source: On the top navigation menu, click **Setup**, then click **Setup Manager**.
trans-unit.target: On the top navigation menu, click **Setup**, then click **Setup Manager**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup Manager
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup Manager

trans-unit.source: On the left navigation menu, select **Users/Roles**, then click **Manage Roles**.
trans-unit.target: On the left navigation menu, select **Users/Roles**, then click **Manage Roles**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Roles
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Roles

trans-unit.source: Click **New Role**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New Role**.

trans-unit.source: Type in a **Name** for you new role, and select the **Single Sign-On Only** checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Type in a **Name** for you new role, and select the **Single Sign-On Only** checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Name the new role.
trans-unit.target: Name the new role.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click **Permissions**.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click **Permissions**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Setup**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Setup**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Permissions
trans-unit.target: Go to Permissions

trans-unit.source: Select **Set Up SAM Single Sign-on**, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Set Up SAM Single Sign-on**, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: On the top navigation menu, click **Setup**, then click **Setup Manager**.
trans-unit.target: On the top navigation menu, click **Setup**, then click **Setup Manager**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup Manager
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup Manager

trans-unit.source: On the left navigation menu, select **Users/Roles**, then click **Manage Users**.
trans-unit.target: On the left navigation menu, select **Users/Roles**, then click **Manage Users**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Users
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Users

trans-unit.source: Select a test user.
trans-unit.target: Select a test user.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Users
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Users

trans-unit.source: On the Roles dialog, select the role that you have created and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: On the Roles dialog, select the role that you have created and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Users
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Users

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, see the section below titled [Assign Users to NetSuite](#step-4-assign-users-to-netsuite).
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, see the section below titled [Assign Users to NetSuite](#step-4-assign-users-to-netsuite).

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Enable Automated User Provisioning
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Enable Automated User Provisioning

trans-unit.source: In Azure Active Directory, on the Quick Start page for NetSuite, click on **Configure user provisioning**.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Active Directory, on the Quick Start page for NetSuite, click on **Configure user provisioning**.

trans-unit.source: Configure user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configure user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In the dialog that opens, type in your admin credentials for NetSuite, then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog that opens, type in your admin credentials for NetSuite, then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Type in your NetSuite admin credentials.
trans-unit.target: Type in your NetSuite admin credentials.

trans-unit.source: On the confirmation page, type in your email address to receive notifications of provisioning failures.
trans-unit.target: On the confirmation page, type in your email address to receive notifications of provisioning failures.

trans-unit.source: Confirm.
trans-unit.target: Confirm.

trans-unit.source: Click **Complete** to close the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **Complete** to close the dialog.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Assign Users to NetSuite
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Assign Users to NetSuite

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, start creating a new test account in the directory.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, start creating a new test account in the directory.

trans-unit.source: On the NetSuite Quick Start page, click on the **Assign Users** button.
trans-unit.target: On the NetSuite Quick Start page, click on the **Assign Users** button.

trans-unit.source: Click on Assign Users
trans-unit.target: Click on Assign Users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, and click the **Assign** button at the bottom of the screen:
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, and click the **Assign** button at the bottom of the screen:

trans-unit.source: If you haven't enable automated user provisioning, then you'll see the following prompt to confirm:
trans-unit.target: If you haven't enable automated user provisioning, then you'll see the following prompt to confirm:

trans-unit.source: If you have enabled automated user provisioning, then you'll see a prompt to define what type of role the user should have in NetSuite.
trans-unit.target: If you have enabled automated user provisioning, then you'll see a prompt to define what type of role the user should have in NetSuite.

trans-unit.source: Newly provisioned users should appear in your NetSuite environment after a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Newly provisioned users should appear in your NetSuite environment after a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: To test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel at [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com/), sign into the test account, and click on **NetSuite**.
trans-unit.target: To test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel at [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com/), sign into the test account, and click on **NetSuite**.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
